definition[0]: to choose something without knowing very much about it, and hope that it will be what you want
example[0]: We hadn’t booked a hotel so we had to take pot luck.
definition[1]: to have a meal at someone’s home in which you eat whatever they have available, rather than food which has been specially bought for the occasion
example[1]: I’m not sure what there is in the fridge – you’ll have to take pot luck.
